isis.stitle: DIAMONDLIFE™ (BOSCH PIN SLIDE) DISC BRAKES For Vehicles Built Before June 3, 2002 - REMOVE - CALIPER

svcprocinfo.para: During service procedure, keep grease and other foreign material away from caliper assembly, disc brake pads, brake rotor and external surfaces of hub. Handle parts carefully to avoid damage to caliper, rotor, disc brake pads and brake lines.
In the event the original disc brake pads are to be used again, be sure to mark them in some manner so that they are reinstalled in same location.

important.para: If a new caliper assembly is being installed, be sure that the bleeder screw (Item 1, Figure 21) is installed in Upper (top) hydraulic line port of caliper (Item 2, Figure 21).

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. BLEEDER SCREW WITH CAP (UPPER HYDRAULIC LINE PORT)
3. HYDRAULIC BRAKE LINE HOSE (LOWER HYDRAULIC LINE PORT)

svcprocinfo.para: The following steps refer to only one wheel. The same procedure will need to be performed at each wheel.

svcsubproc.title: Remove

step1.para: Position vehicle on suitable floor stands and remove wheel (tire and rim). Refer to GROUP 17 - WHEELS in the Master Service Manual for proper wheel (tire and rim) removal.

warning.para: A jack must never be used alone to support a vehicle while under-chassis service is being performed. The jack may lower and serious personal injury could result. Always support vehicle with suitable floor stands.

step1.para: Insert a screwdriver in one of the rotor cooling fin slots and pry the caliper outboard pushing the caliper pistons into the piston bores. This will allow removal of caliper assembly (Figure 22).

figure.caption: Figure 22. Push Caliper Outboard Pushing Pistons into Piston Bores

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 23 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: On front axles only, remove hex nut and lock washer (Item 1) and lift brake line retaining clip (Item 2) off threaded stud (Item 3) on the steering knuckle hose support bracket (Item 4). This will allow the brake line hose to hang free.

figure.caption: Figure 23. Removing Brake Line Retaining Clip from Front Axle Hose Support Bracket

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 24 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: On front brakes, remove hex head bolt (Item 1) and remove brake line retaining clip (Item 2) from caliper (Item 3).

Disconnect hydraulic brake line hex fitting (Item 4) from the caliper (Item 3) and remove brake line hose (Item 5). Cap the brake line hose and plug the caliper inlet to prevent brake fluid leakage. Position brake line hose out of the way. Be careful to avoid getting grease or brake fluid on disc pads.

figure.caption: Figure 24. Remove Front Brake Line Hose from Caliper

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 25 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: On rear brakes, if vehicle is equipped with ABS brake system and/or air suspension system, note that the brake line hose (Item 1) is attached to ABS sensor cable (Item 2) with tywrap straps (Item 3) from retaining clip (Item 4) on axle (Item 5) to disc brake assembly (Item 6). Remove hex head bolt (Item 7) from retaining clip (Item 4). Remove hex head bolt (Item 8) and brake line retaining clip (Item 9) from caliper (Item 10). This will allow the brake line hose to hang free while rotating the caliper down.

important.para: If it becomes necessary to cut any of the tywrap straps (Item 3) to allow caliper to rotate all the way down during caliper removal, note the location of the tywrap strap before cutting it off, so it can be replaced in the proper place after service is completed.

step1.para: Disconnect hydraulic brake line hex fitting (Item 11) from brake caliper (Item 10) and remove brake line hose (Item 1). Cap the brake line hose and plug the caliper inlet to prevent brake fluid leakage. Position brake line hose out of the way. Be careful to avoid getting grease or brake fluid on disc pads.

figure.caption: Figure 25. Remove Rear Brake Line Hose from Caliper

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 26 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove upper (top) hex mounting bolt (Item 1) securing the caliper (Item 2) to the anchor plate (Item 3), driver side front brake shown.

figure.caption: Figure 26. Remove Upper Hex Mounting Bolt to Lower and Remove Caliper

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 27 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Carefully rotate the caliper (Item 1) open about the lower (bottom) hex mounting bolt and guide pin (Items 2 and 3), driver side front brake shown.
Remove lower (bottom) hex mounting bolt (Item 2) securing the caliper (Item 1) to the anchor plate (Item 4) and remove caliper, driver side front brake shown.

note.para:
Use care to avoid damaging or dislodging the guide pin boots (Items 5 and 7). Do not pull on guide pins (Items 3 and 6), this may dislodge guide pin boot from guide pin or anchor plate grooves. If boot is dislodged, refer to ANCHOR PLATE AND SPLASH SHIELD, Disassemble
, ANCHOR PLATE AND SPLASH SHIELD, Clean and Inspect
and ANCHOR PLATE AND SPLASH SHIELD, Assemble
to disassemble, clean and inspect and assemble to repair or replace guide pin boots.

figure.caption: Figure 27. Rotate Caliper Open About Lower Hex Mounting Bolt and Guide Pin

note.para:
Several changes have been incorporated within the anchor plate assembly and caliper mounting bolts on vehicles manufactured after June 3, 2002. It is important to recognize that these changes are not found on disc brakes on vehicles manufactured before June 3, 2002, unless a complete rebuild of the anchor plate assembly was performed on the vehicle. The components that have changed are the leading and trailing guide pins (Figure 67)
and (Figure 68)
and caliper mounting bolts (Figure 71) .

step1.para:
Once the caliper is removed and placed on a clean dry work surface, refer to CALIPER, Disassemble
, CALIPER, Clean and Inspect
and CALIPER, Assemble
to disassemble, clean and inspect and assemble to repair or rebuild caliper.
